vocabURI="http://lod.data-archive.ac.uk/skoshasset/a79b74cd-ce2a-435a-9250-ad5453874690">ZIMBABWE</keyword>         <topcClas>Economic conditions and indicators - Economics</topcClas>         <topcClas>Government and political systems - Politics</topcClas>       </subject>       <abstract><p>Abstract copyright UK Data Service and data collection copyright owner.</p>The <i>International Monetary Fund (IMF) Government Finance Statistics (GFS)</i> database provides current and internationally comparable annual time series data on the finances and fiscal policies of IMF member governments from 1990 onwards. Topics covered include:<ul><li>deficit/surplus or total financing</li><li>revenues or grants, expenditures</li><li>lending minus repayments</li><li>domestic financing</li><li>foreign financing</li><li>domestic debt or total debt, and foreign debt</li></ul>This database was first provided by the UK Data Service in November 2004. The UK Data Service web site includes further information on its <i>IMF GFS</i> holdings, including a <a href="http://ukdataservice.ac.uk//use-data/guides/dataset/gfs.aspx" title ="IMF Government Finance Statistics dataset user guide">dataset user guide</a> and details of <a href="http://dx.doi.org/10.5257/imf/gfs/2011-09" title ="IMF Government Finance Statistics dataset latest database updates">latest database updates</a>.<br> <br> <b>Citation:</b> The bibliographic citation for the database is: International Monetary Fund (<i>{YYYY}</i>): Government Finance Statistics (<i>{date/edition of dataset}</i>). Mimas, University of Manchester. DOI: <i>{edition specific doi - e.g. <a href="http://dx.doi.org/10.5257/imf/gfs/2011-09">http://dx.doi.org/10.5257/imf/gfs/2011-09</a>}</i>. <br> <br> <b>IMF GFS Historical data citation:</b> The bibliographic citation for the database is: International Monetary Fund (2006): Government Finance Statistics (Edition: March 2006). Mimas, University of Manchester. DOI: 10.5257/imf/gfs/2006-03. <br> <br> </abstract>       <abstract><B>Main Topics</B>:<br>Topics covered include:<ul><li>finance</li><li>economics</li><li>financing</li><li>funding</li><li>revenue</li><li>public expenditure</li><li>payments</li><li>government spending</li><li>financial management</li><li>grants</li><li>debts</li><li>public debt</li><li>national debt</li><li>public finance</li><li>fiscal policy</li><li>financial policy</li><li>taxation</li><li>bonds</li><li>educational expenditure</li><li>defence expenditure</li><li>social welfare expenditure</li><li>educational finance</li><li>health care costs</li><li>local finance</li><li>social welfare finance</li><li>national economy</li><li>agricultural economics</li><li>exchange rates</li><li>gross domestic product</li><li>population</li></ul></abstract>       <sumDscr>         <timePrd>These data run from 1990 to the present and are updated quarterly.</timePrd>         <collDate>Where the data are available, annual entries generally begin in 1990 and run to the latest available year. The historical GFS contains data from 1972 to 1989.</collDate>         <nation>Multi-nation</nation>         <geogUnit>Countries</geogUnit>         <anlyUnit>Administrative units (geographical/political)</anlyUnit>         <universe>Cross-national; National</universe>         <universe>Over 150 countries are covered by the Government Finance Statistics: Afghanistan, Albania, Algeria, Argentina, Armenia, Australia, Austria, Azerbaijan, Bahamas, Bahrain, Bangladesh, Barbados, Belarus, Belgium, Belize, Benin, Bhutan, Bolivia, Bosnia-Herzegovina, Botswana, Brazil, Bulgaria, Burkina Faso, Burundi, Cambodia, Cameroon, Canada, Central African Republic, Chile, China, Colombia, Congo Republic of, Democratic Republic of the Congo, Costa Rica, Cote d'Ivoire, Croatia, Cyprus, Czech Republic, Denmark, Djibouti, Dominican Republic, Ecuador, Egypt, El Salvador, Estonia, Ethiopia, Fiji, Finland, France, Gambia, Gaza Strip, Georgia, Germany, Ghana, Greece, Grenada, Guatemala, Guinea, Honduras, Hong Kong, Hungary, Iceland, India, Indonesia, Islamic Republic of Iran, Ireland, Israel, Italy, Jamaica, Japan, Jordan, Kazakhstan, Kenya, Korea, Kuwait, Kyrgyzstan, Latvia, Lebanon, Lesotho, Lithuania, Luxembourg, Macao, Madagascar, Malaysia, Maldives, Mali, Malta, Mauritius, Mexico, Republic of Moldova, Mongolia, Morocco, Myanmar, Namibia, Nepal, Netherlands, Netherlands Antilles, New Zealand, Nicaragua, Norway, Oman, Pakistan, Panama, Papua New Guinea, Paraguay, Peru, Philippines, Poland, Portugal, Qatar, Romania, Russian Federation, Rwanda, Saint Kitts and Nevis, Saint Vincent and the Grenadines, San Marino, Senegal, Serbia and Montenegro, Seychelles, Sierra Leone, Singapore, Slovakia, Slovenia, South Africa, Spain, Sri Lanka, Sudan, Swaziland, Sweden, Switzerland, Syrian Arab Republic, Tajikistan, Tanzania, Thailand, Togo, Trinidad and Tobago, Tunisia, Turkey, Uganda, Ukraine, United Arab Emirates, United Kingdom, United States, Uruguay, Vanuatu, Venezuela, Vietnam, West Bank, Yemen Republic of, Yugoslavia, Zambia, Zimbabwe.</universe>         <dataKind>Numeric data</dataKind>         <dataKind> Aggregate (macro) level</dataKind>       </sumDscr>     </stdyInfo>     <method>       <dataColl>         <timeMeth>Time Series</timeMeth>         <timeMeth>Annual. These data are updated quarterly.</timeMeth>         <sampProc>See documentation for details.</sampProc>         <collMode>For details of methodology, please see the <a href="http://ukdataservice.ac.uk//use-data/guides/dataset/gfs.aspx" title=" IMF Government Finance Statistics"> dataset user guide</a>.</collMode>         <sources />         <weight>Weighting used.  See documentation for details.</weight>       </dataColl>     </method>     <dataAccs>       <setAvail>         <accsPlac>UK Data Service</accsPlac>       </setAvail>       <useStmt>         <specPerm>Third party access conditions apply</specPerm>         <restrctn>Effective January 1st 2015, the IMF introduced a new policy whereby access to the IMF online statistics databases became free to all users.  As a result of this policy the IMF datasets hosted by the UK Data Service are now freely available to all. Please refer to the IMF's <a href="http://www.imf.org/external/terms.htm" title="Special Terms and Conditions Pertaining to the Use of Data">Special Terms and Conditions Pertaining to the Use of Data</a>.</restrctn>         <contact><a href=http://www.ukdataservice.ac.uk/help/get-in-touch.aspx>Get in touch</a></contact>       </useStmt>     </dataAccs>     <othrStdyMat>       <relStdy>4745 IMF Direction of Trade Statistics, 1980-2014 </relStdy>       <relStdy>4772 IMF International Financial Statistics, 1948-2014 </relStdy>       <relStdy>4963 IMF Balance of Payments Statistics, 1967-2014 </relStdy>       <relStdy>5761 IMF World Economic Outlook, 1980-2018 </relStdy>       <relStdy>7271 IMF Annual Report on Exchange Arrangements and Exchange Restrictions, 1999-2013 </relStdy>       <relStdy>7302 IMF eLibrary Text Collection, 1951-2013 </relStdy>       <relPubl>   </relPubl>       <relPubl>   </relPubl>       <othRefs>Language Of Study Description: English</othRefs>       <othRefs>Language Of Study Documentation: English</othRefs>     </othrStdyMat>   </stdyDscr> </codeBook>
